what: Keep best vegplot when multiple exist for site — QC_best_vegplot_for_site
title: Keep best vegplot when multiple exist for site — QC_best_vegplot_for_site
text: function determines sites multiple vegplots keeps best vegplot. best vegplot decided based number records vegplot (.e., number rows vegplot table). function intended provide basic functionality avoid gross misrepresentations (.e., pseudo-replication vegplot/site relationships). function considered replacement careful review vegplots. , multiple vegplots number records, function error. commonly occurs two vegplots identical data. best solution case remove duplicated vegplots NASIS.

title: QC vegplots — QC_vegplots_summary
text: QC_vegplots_summary() produces summary regarding completeness vegplots, including species richness plot percent species abundance data. information can used remove vegplots analyses due lack completeness. QC_vegplots_remove_plots() allows remove vegplots dataset based siteiids parameters related vegplot completeness.

title: QC vegplots — QC_vegplots_summary
code: QC_vegplots_summary(veg_df)  QC_vegplots_remove_plots(   veg_df = NULL,   my_QC_vegplots_summary = NULL,   min_species = NULL,   min_perc_species_with_abund = NULL,   min_perc_species_level_id = NULL,   siteiids = NULL )

title: QC vegplots — QC_vegplots_summary
text: veg_df veg_df created using ecositer::formatted_veg_df() my_QC_vegplots_summary results ecositer::my_QC_vegplots_summary() min_species site must >= N species included siteiids siteiids removed defined user min_abund sites must >= N% species abundance data included (e.g., entering 90 include sites 90% species abundance data). WARNING: keep sites missing abundance data intend run vegetation analyses using abundance data, abundance values populated. run analyses presence/absence data, abundance data needed.

title: QC vegplots — QC_vegplots_summary
text: QC_vegplots_summary() returns summary vegetation plot sampling detail QC_vegplots_remove_plots() returns veg_df satisfying defined requirements completeness

Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
text: big_beta_diversity calculates distance matrix using distance measure, big beta diversity.

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
code: big_beta_diversity(   veg_df,   wisconsin = FALSE,   remove_rare = FALSE,   relative_dist = TRUE,   trans = TRUE )

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
text: veg_df properly formatted vegetation dataframe (formatted_veg_df). data QCed ensure meets minimum data requirements (QC_vegplots) remove_rare decimal value defining fraction sites species must present included (e.g., 0.01 means species must present > 1% plots). FALSE include species dataset. relative_dist relativized 0-1 dissimilarity values using: $$z_i = \frac{x_i - min(x)}{max(x) - min(x)}$$

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
text: distance matrix. distance matrix can used ordination determine similarity different ecological sites.

title: Big beta diversity — big_beta_diversity
code: my_bbd <- big_beta_diversity(veg_df = my_veg_df) #> Error: object 'my_veg_df' not found

title: Create formatted vegetation dataframe — create_veg_df
text: function provides access vegetation data multiple sources returns data format. QC performed function.

title: Create formatted vegetation dataframe — create_veg_df
code: create_veg_df(   from = c("web_report", "SS", "static"),   ecositeid = NULL,   static_location = NULL,   best_vegplot = TRUE )

title: Create formatted vegetation dataframe — create_veg_df
text: origin vegetation data. "web_report" provides public data NASIS. "SS" uses users NASIS selected set (NASIS connection required). "static" uses local .sqlite NASIS database. ecositeid ecositeid interest - required using = "web_report". used = "SS" = "static", limits returns ecositeid provided. static_location file path static NASIS .sqlite database - typically generated using ecositer::vegStaticNASIS()

what: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
title: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
text: nmds_ecosite runs NMDS using vegan package. NMDS numerous settings can adjusted, can manipulated arguments function. function intended used quick way producing ordinations. interested optimizing NMDS, please research. minimum, understand stress evaluate stress report results.

title: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
text: veg_summary veg_summary object ecositer::veg_summary() function saved. ecosite ecosite ecosite(s) want include ordination. interested ordinating multiple ecosites together, concatenate ecosites interest (e.g., c("", "b")) pres_abs use TRUE convert data presence/absence. robust option. missing abundance values, presence/absence used. abundance data, use FALSE. nmds_dim specify number dimensions want NMDS. value affect stress considerably. reduce_species NA want remove species. numeric value, interpretted percent, specifying minimum percentage plots species must present remain dataset.

title: Run NMDS on vegetation data — nmds_ecosite
text: NMDS object generated using vegan package

code: formatted_veg <- formatted_veg_df(static_location = "C:/Users/Nathan.Roe/Documents/SEKI/CA792_veg.sqlite") #> Error in formatted_veg_df(static_location = "C:/Users/Nathan.Roe/Documents/SEKI/CA792_veg.sqlite"): could not find function "formatted_veg_df" my_veg_summary <- ecositer::veg_summary(veg_df = formatted_veg) #> Error: object 'formatted_veg' not found my_nmds <- ecositer::nmds_ecosite(veg_summary = my_veg_summary, ecosite = "F022AK100CA", pres_abs = TRUE, nmds_dim = 2, reduce_species = NA) #> Error: object 'my_veg_summary' not found
